author: adiasg
content:
Are any of the clients using the `minimal` style of slashing DB for slashing protection? `minimal` meaning only storing the latest attestation & block that was signed, as defined here: https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-3076#rationale
> Whilst the format outlined in this specification is most similar to the old complete, clients who wish to follow a simpler slashing protection strategy (i.e. the old minimal), can do so by simply inserting a “fake” signed_attestation (with the correct source_epoch and target_epoch numbers), and a “fake” signed_block (with the correct slot number).

author: ajsutton
content: Yes. Teku doesn’t record each individual attestation and block signed to keep the slashing protection as simple as possible. So it can only produce the minimal format.
